channel.title: Comments on: How to flip a bit in SQL Server by using the Bitwise NOT operator
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: I should have posted it too as I answered this same question twice (using bitwise XOR operator). The second time I had to dig for my original answer as I forgot how I solved it
item.content:encoded: I should have posted it too as I answered this same question twice (using bitwise XOR operator). The second time I had to dig for my original answer as I forgot how I solved it

item.title: By: Erik
item.dc:creator: Erik
item.description: But your way with the bit operator ~ might be faster and is more explicitly correct since the data type isn't converted.
item.content:encoded: But your way with the bit operator ~ might be faster and is more explicitly correct since the data type isn’t converted.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Nice…I was waiting for your comment ðŸ™‚

yes duh

1-1 = 0
1-0 = 1

item.title: By: Erik
item.dc:creator: Erik
item.description: If the output is going right back into a bit column you can just do `1 - BitCol` and it will work fine, too.
item.content:encoded: If the output is going right back into a bit column you can just do `1 – BitCol` and it will work fine, too.
